meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a pig in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The man's loud snorting and messy eating were truly swinish.
meanings.sent2: The farm was filled with swinish creatures rolling in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The swinish behavior of the children at the party was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her snout-like nose gave her a swinish appearance.
meanings.sent5: The swinish grunts echoed through the pigpen.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a greedy, selfish, or uncouth manner.
meanings.sent1: His swinish desire for more food led to overeating.
meanings.sent2: The swinish businessman cared only about his own profits.
meanings.sent3: It was swinish of him to grab all the cookies without sharing.
meanings.sent4: The swinish attitude of the crowd pushed others aside.
meanings.sent5: Her swinish behavior at the buffet shocked the other guests.
